channel.title: Consumed
channel.description:
Recently, one of my friends passed away from a cocaine overdose and I couldn't stop thinking about it, so I cobbled something together in photoshop to express how I feel.
[img]http://img209.imageshack.us/img209/5537/consumedmo4.gif[/img]

item.title: Consumed
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

[quote=“dragonus18, post:18, topic:163833”][quote author=RXVL link=topic=222547.msg1927886#msg1927886 date=1197529676]
It’s large because I’m better at doing big pictures than I am at smaller ones.
[/quote]
i know how you feel.[/quote]
I suck at image editing in the first place ;D

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Consumed
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I have to agree with exe. Though, you may have tried to do something good, or needed to express your emotions. I just don’t feel that was the right way to portray your friends death. If anything it makes it seem as if you’re angry at him. Or possibly hatred towards the drug. It might even be there was no emotion behind the image. It’s just too confusing and I don’t see the purpose behind the image.

If anything, I might would remove the abstract brushes, do a grunge brush in the background, and then maybe try again with the abstract brush. I would also tone down the glow on the needle and make the biohazard symbol a little transparent. then do a color layer and render the layer with maybe cloud. do that a couple times with a couple different colors that stick with the green color.

I don’t want to rate it, because even if there weren’t any emotion behind the image, it came from the heart. But I just wanted to give you some tips on improving the image. You can take them or leave them. I hope I haven’t caused any hostility.

Read full topic

item.title: Consumed
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Thanks, I used a biohazard brush and then duplicated the layout, then went around with a 35px circle smudge and expanded it out.

And yes, it was sad that Chris (that was his name) had to go, but hopefully hes in a better place now.

Read full topic
